Class AudioManager

java.lang.Object
view.AudioManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer
public class AudioManager extends Object implements Observer
manages all the audio of the game. it follows the singleton and observer pattern: only a single instance of the audio manager can exist, and plays a certain sound effect whenever it gets notified from an observable model via update(Observable, Object).

  • Field Details

    • instance

      private static AudioManager instance
      instance of AudioManager

    • soundEffects

      private static Map<String, List<Clip>> soundEffects
      a Map of sound effects. each sound name is represented as a String (key), and each sound/name has 5 (CopiesPerSound) copies per sound. this allows multiple sound clips to play simultaneously

    • CopiesPerSound

      private static final int CopiesPerSound
      number of copies per sound
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • AudioManager

      private AudioManager()
      manages the audio of the game. it follows the singleton pattern, so only a single instance of SoundManager is allowed. it initializes the soundEffects via loadSoundEffects().

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static AudioManager getInstance()
      creates the AudioManager instance if there isnt one, returns AudioManager if already created.
      Returns:
      instance of AudioManager

    • update

      public void update(Observable o, Object arg)
      plays a sound via playSound(String) whenever an observable object sends a specific notification
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer
      Parameters:
      o - the observable object.
      arg - an argument passed to the notifyObservers method.

    • loadSoundEffects

      private void loadSoundEffects()
      loads all the sound effects from the 'res' directory

    • loadSound

      private void loadSound(String soundName, String filePath)
      populates soundEffects map by loading 5 same sound clips given the sound effect filepath.
      Parameters:
      soundName - name of the sound
      filePath - path to the .wav sound in the 'res' folder

    • playSound

      private void playSound(String soundName)
      creates a new thread that plays the sound's name. this was done because otherwise, whenever a sound plays, it would freeze the game thread for 100 ish milliseconds. searches an available sound clip in the soundEffects map that is not currently playing
      Parameters:
      soundName - name of the sound to play
